author: Nikhila Henry
text:
A Dalit research scholar of the University of Hyderabad allegedly hanged himself to death on Sunday, 15 days after he was expelled from his hostel along with four other researchers.

The five Dalit students of the Ambedkar Students Association (ASA) were on a sleep-in strike in the open on the campus ever since their expulsion.

On Sunday morning, Rohith Vemula strayed away from the protesters’ camp and spent the day in one of the rooms of New Research Scholars' hostel.

He was found hanging in the room at 7.30 p.m. He hanged himself using the blue banner of the ASA, a student outfit which has been fighting for Dalit rights on the campus.

Vice-Chancellor P. Appa Rao expressed shock. “I am as shocked and worried as anyone else,” he told The Hindu .

According to the university, the five students were prevented from entering the hostel following a scuffle between two students organisations — the Akhila Bharatiya Vidyarthi Parishand and the ASA — on August 3 last year.
title: Dalit research scholar ends life
